title: Aggregate abundance columns — QC_aggregate_abundance
text: function used aggregate abundance data one column (pct_cover). Abundance can come four columns: "akstratumcoverclasspct", "speciescancovpct", "speciescomppct", "understorygrcovpct". record uses multiple abundance columns, pct_cover calculated average values. one abundance column used record, value used pct_cover.

text: function determines sites multiple vegetation plots keeps best. best vegetation plot decided based number records vegetation plot (.e., number rows vegetation plot table). function intended provide basic functionality avoid gross misrepresentations (.e., pseudo-replication vegetation plot/site relationships). function considered replacement careful review vegetation plots. , multiple vegetation plots number records, function error. commonly occurs two vegetation plots identical data. best solution case remove duplicated vegetation plots NASIS.

title: QC taxonomies for unifying — QC_unify_taxa
text: QC_unify_data returns dataframe taxa QCed opportunities unify. two types situations evaluatied. first whether IDs beyond species (.e., var ssp) well species. example, Pinus contorta Pinus contorta var. murrayana. Users may want unify observations (e.g., change Pinus contorta). second situation observations genus well genus species. example IDs Pinus Pinus contorta. instances, possible unify records (e.g., end project determine one species genus present). Statistical analyses recognize relationship different classes, therefore taxonomically similar situations viewed distance measures completely unrelated. Therefore, reasonable, best unify taxonomic observations.

title: Summarize vegetation plot completeness — QC_veg_completeness
text: function calculates summary statistics vegetation plots grouped vegplotiid, specifically: total_records - total number records associated vegplotiid unique_species - number unique species recorded vegplotiid. percent_to_species - percentage observations identified species level (determined presence space plantsciname). percent_with_abund - percentage observations non-NA value pct_cover column.

title: Big beta diversity — big_beta_diversity
text: big_beta_diversity calculates distance matrix using distance measure, big beta diversity.

title: Big beta diversity — big_beta_diversity
code: big_beta_diversity(   veg_df,   wisconsin = FALSE,   remove_rare = FALSE,   relative_dist = TRUE,   trans = TRUE )

title: Big beta diversity — big_beta_diversity
text: veg_df properly formatted vegetation dataframe (formatted_veg_df). data QCed ensure meets minimum data requirements (QC_vegplots) remove_rare decimal value defining fraction sites species must present included (e.g., 0.01 means species must present > 1% plots). FALSE include species dataset. relative_dist relativized 0-1 dissimilarity values using: $$z_i = \frac{x_i - min(x)}{max(x) - min(x)}$$

title: Big beta diversity — big_beta_diversity
text: distance matrix. distance matrix can used ordination determine similarity different ecological sites.

title: Big beta diversity — big_beta_diversity
code: my_bbd <- big_beta_diversity(veg_df = my_veg_df) #> Error: object 'my_veg_df' not found

title: Create local vegetation database — create_local_veg_db
text: create_local_veg_db saves NASIS selected set local drive .sqlite database. function utilizes soilDB::createStaticNASIS, includes appropriate tables access vegetation data. output can used reliable, local copy query results, allowing user change NASIS selected set still access data interest. file extension needs ".sqlite". working dataset commonly new data entered, probably best work NASIS selected set rather using local sqlite database.

"static" uses local .sqlite NASIS database. ecositeid ecositeid interest - required using = "web_report". used = "SS" = "static", limits returns ecositeid provided. static_location file path static NASIS .sqlite database - typically generated using ecositer::vegStaticNASIS()

what: Run NMDS on vegetation data — nmds_ecosite
title: Run NMDS on vegetation data — nmds_ecosite
text: nmds_ecosite runs NMDS using vegan package. NMDS numerous settings can adjusted, can manipulated arguments function. function intended used quick way producing ordinations. interested optimizing NMDS, please research. minimum, understand stress evaluate stress report results.

title: Run NMDS on vegetation data — nmds_ecosite
code: nmds_ecosite(veg_summary, ecosite, pres_abs, nmds_dim, reduce_species)

title: Run NMDS on vegetation data — nmds_ecosite
text: veg_summary veg_summary object ecositer::veg_summary() function saved. ecosite ecosite ecosite(s) want include ordination. interested ordinating multiple ecosites together, concatenate ecosites interest (e.g., c("", "b")) pres_abs use TRUE convert data presence/absence. robust option. missing abundance values, presence/absence used. abundance data, use FALSE. nmds_dim specify number dimensions want NMDS. value affect stress considerably. reduce_species NA want remove species. numeric value, interpretted percent, specifying minimum percentage plots species must present remain dataset.

text: veg_df properly formatted vegetation data frame taxa taxa interest, typically genus level (e.g., "Arabis"). used regular expression pattern.
